title: Diagrams of Br2 and I2 - explain BP difference

content.question: The diagram above shows molecules of Br2 and I2 drawn to the same scale. Which of the following is the best explanation for the difference in the boiling points of liquid Br2 and I2, which are 59oC and 184oC, respectively?

choices.label: Solid iodine is a network covalent solid, whereas solid bromine is a molecular solid.
The covalent bonds in I2 molecules are weaker than those in Br2 molecules.
I2 molecules have electron clouds that are more polarizable than those of Br2 molecules, thus London dispersion forces are stronger in liquid I2.
Bromine has a greater electronegativity than iodine, thus there are stronger dipole-dipole forces in liquid bromine than in liquid iodine.

content.answer: I2 molecules have electron clouds that are more polarizable than those of Br2 molecules, thus London dispersion forces are stronger in liquid I2.
